pyclustkit.eval.index_specifics.representatives module

pyclustkit.eval.index_specifics.representatives.closest_representatives(X: array, reps_positions: object) → object[source]

For each representative of each cluster find the closest representative of another cluster.

pyclustkit.eval.index_specifics.representatives.density(X, y, rcr)[source]
pyclustkit.eval.index_specifics.representatives.inter_density(densities)[source]
pyclustkit.eval.index_specifics.representatives.intra_dens(x, y, reps, cluster_centers, s)[source]

Computes the relative intra-cluster density. That is the number of points within range of the representative points of each cluster. paper: Definition 6 :param x: The dataset :type x: np.ndarray :param y: Cluster labels found :type y: np.ndarray :param reps: Representatives per cluster :type reps: dict :param s: shrinking factor value :type s: float :param cluster_centers: cluster center vectors in dictionary {cluster: center, …} :type cluster_centers: dict

Returns:

intra_dens as defined in definition 6 in paper

Return type:

(float)

pyclustkit.eval.index_specifics.representatives.midpoint(X, idx_0, idx_1)[source]
pyclustkit.eval.index_specifics.representatives.respective_closest_representatives(reps_positions, closest_reps)[source]

Finds the respective closest representatives per cluster combination. That is pairs of representatives from different clusters that have each other as closest representative.

pyclustkit.eval.index_specifics.s module

pyclustkit.eval.index_specifics.s.return_s(X: array | DataFrame, labels: array | DataFrame, precomputed_distances=False) → Tuple[int, int, int, int][source]

Calculates the necessary values for the gamma and tau cluster validity indices. Returns the following: s_plus : Times points within the same cluster have distance less than points in different clusters. s_minus : Times points within the same cluster have distance more than points in different clusters. nb : Distances between all the pairs of points that are in different clusters nw : Distances between all the pairs of points that are in the same cluster.

pyclustkit.eval.index_specifics.s.upper_triangle(matrix)[source]

Returns the upper triangle of values of symmetric matrix. Useful for collecting unique values in a pairwise distance matrix

pyclustkit.eval.index_specifics.sd module

pyclustkit.eval.index_specifics.sd.dens_bw(X, y, sigma)[source]

Calculates the inter-cluster variance based on number of points in the neighborhood of the middle point between clusters. See definition 1 in paper.

Parameters:

  • clust_std

  • X (pd.DataFrame or np.array) – Dataset records.

  • y (pd.DataFrame or np.array) – Cluster labels.

Returns:

Inter-Cluster density.

Return type:

float
